dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: A brilliant yellow sun beats down on a vast orangeish wasteland. As we begin a long, slow PAN of the desert, th following is SUPERED onto the screen:

dialogues.speaker: "SAN DIMAS, CALIFORNIA"
dialogues.text: TITLE FADES, and is replaced by: “2687 A.D." Then that TITLE also FADES. Continue PANNING, and finally

dialogues.speaker: _A CLUSTER OF FUTURISTIC DOMES
dialogues.text: which shimmer in the distance. Soon a distant SOLITARY FIGURE, dressed all in black, silently strides INTO FRAME, dust kicking up behind ‘hin. As the Figure approaches the largest of the domes, we beg to MOVE IN, and we: cuT To:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A magnificent, crystalline structure -- like a vast, futuristic cathedral. Everything about this place implies grandeur, solemnity and importance. Deep, metallic MUSIC echoes through the dome as --

dialogues.speaker: TWO HUGE DOORS
dialogues.text: open, and the Figure enters. This is:

dialogues.speaker: RUFUS
dialogues.text: And he is the personification of everything that'is, has been, or will be rock and roll. Cool, cavalier, and cocky he’ is dressed very stylishly and wears ultra-hip sunglasses. He steps inside the hall, the two huge doors shutting solidly behind him. He begins walking, his footsteps echoing loudly.

dialogues.speaker: O
dialogues.text: He stops in the middle of the room and nods respectfully toward:

dialogues.speaker: THE OTHER END OF THE ROOM
dialogues.text: where, for the first time, we SEE three FIGURES, seated i mid-air, as if suspended invisibly. All have long hair an beards (sort of like the members of ZZ Top), wear white, sport dark sunglasses, and slowly tap their feet in rhyth to the echoing, metallic music. These are the three most important people in the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rufus stands, patiently, as the LEADER regally returns hi nod and begins to speak, his voice resonating through the dome.

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: It is time. Rufus nods. The Leader motions toward: THE CENTER OF THE ROOM : . where the ceiling begins to iris open, BRIGHT WHITE LIGHT . pouring through the widening chasm. Soon the light is pierced by:

dialogues.speaker: A LARGE, BLACK OBELISK
dialogues.text: which, barely visible through the brightness, begins to descend toward the floor. This spectacular explosion of LIGHT and MUSIC reaches a tumultuous crescendo, then suddenly stops. The ceiling irises closed.

dialogues.speaker: THE LEADER
dialogues.text: looks at the obelisk, then gestures with his hand and:

dialogues.speaker: THE OBELISK
dialogues.text: begins a rapid and magical transformation. When complete, the obelisk has taken the form of a 1987 PHONE BOOTH. Glass doors, a telephone, the works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © RUFUS AND THE FIGURES stare reverently at the booth. After a moment, Rufus flip down his shades and turns to the Figures.

dialogues.speaker: RUFUS
dialogues.text: Gentlemen. Be excellent to each other. The Figures nod gravely back at Rufus.

dialogues.speaker: FIGURES
dialogues.text: Party on, dude. Rufus neds and enters --

dialogues.speaker: THE PHONE BOOTH
dialogues.text: where he flips through the attached PHONE BOOK and locate a number. As Rufus lifts the receiver, we SEE a small, two-pronged ANTENNA rise out of the booth and begin to GLOW with a bluish light. Then, with each number Rufus dials, we SEE the BLUE LIGHT from the antenna move down the side of the booth, accompanied by a corresponding CHORD OF HEAVY METAL MUSIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, we HEAR a DRUM BEAT, and as --

dialogues.speaker: THE BLUE LIGHT
dialogues.text: connects with the ground, the floor beneath the booth suddenly opens up with a WHOOSH and, in a brilliant FLASH of BRIGHT WHITE LIGHT and RAUCOUS ROCK AND ROLL ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: «+. the booth disappears. The floor immediately closes back up and the light in the dome returns to normal. Now, for the first time, we becom aware of:

dialogues.speaker: TWO TOWERING PORTRAITS
dialogues.text: Which hang above the doors on the far side of the dome, dominating the room. They are of two MIDDLE AGED MEN with CD jong hair and black t-shirts.

dialogues.speaker: THE THREE IMPORTANT PEOPLE
dialogues.text: Gaze at the portraits, solemn, concerned, and we:

dialogues.speaker: DARKNESS
dialogues.text: We HEAR the VOICES of our two sixteen-year-old heroes, BI and TED. .

dialogues.speaker: TED, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Ready, Bill?

dialogues.speaker: BILL, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Ready, Ted.

dialogues.speaker: TED, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Go for it, dude...

dialogues.speaker: BILL, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: One --

dialogues.speaker: TED, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Two --

dialogues.speaker: BILL AND TED, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: One two three four -- = And they plunge into a riff of upbeat "AIR GUITAR" -- t high-pitched falsetto squeal of voices imitating hard roc guitar licks (sounding something like "nyow - nyow - nyow nyow"). After a few beats, the SOUNDTRACK MUSIC kicks in along wi them, and we:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILL and TED jump INTO FRAME, land on the bus stop bench, and do a series of spasmodic AIR GUITAR riffs. Then, as they leap off the bench TOWARD CAMERA, we begin:

dialogues.speaker: A QUICK SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: In which Bill and Ted do a brief, MTV-type AIR GUITAR min concert: They spin around on their backs; play their air-guitars with their teeth, feet, and ears; trade “solos"; and oo finally, in a resounding conclusion, violently smash t CD air-instruments against the ground, garnering strange from the few people around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They guys look at each other, quite pleased, as the SCHOO BUS pulls up in front of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill and Ted crash into one of the back seats. As we will soon see, they are not hard guys. They are, in fact; remarkably benign and good-natured. Both wear rock and roll t-shirts and jeans with boxers pulled out the back. Of the two, Bill is shorter and darker, with a more angul jaw and a more serious demeanor. He is the "thinker" of the two. Ted is the "dreamer". Taller and blondish, and with a wide-eyed, romantic look, Ted is more into the immediate, whether it be food, fun, or, especially, girls. Ted pulls a construction paper “mock-up" out of his rucksack and unrolls it.

dialogues.speaker: MOCK-UP
dialogues.text: An amateurishly-drawn hard-rock insignia with rearing stallions, devilish faces, flaming manes, phallic guitars and bowing young women. Also on it is the name of the band: "WYLD STALLYNS."

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SHOT
dialogues.text: As the school bus drives through suburban San Dimas, passing malls and. fast food joints, Bill and Ted, in the back, peruse the drawing.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Ted, while I agree that your T-shirts will be most triumphant, the truth is that Wyld Stallyns will never be a super band until we have Eddie Van Halen on guitar.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Yes, Bill, but I do not believe we will get Eddie van Halen until we have triumphant T-shirts.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Ted, it's pointless to have triumphant T-shirts before we even have instruments.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: How can we have instruments when we don't even know how to play?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: That is why we need Eddie Van Halen.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: And that is why we need triumphant T-shirts. Beat. The two lock at each other, grin --

dialogues.speaker: BILL AND TED
dialogues.text: Excellent! -- and as they go into a reprise of AIR GUITAR, again attracting the attention of those around them, we: cuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Typical before-school activity. Students chat and walk to class as: : :

dialogues.speaker: THE SCHOOL BUS
dialogues.text: rolls into the lot and stops. The doors open and students get off. Among them are Bili and Ted, who bound out and start. toward school.

dialogues.speaker: ELSEWHERE IN THE PARKING LOT
dialogues.text: is the "POPULAR GROUP" -- a half a dozen nice-looking students who sit on and around a Trans-Am. Bill and Ted approach on their way to class. Ted eyes two cute preppy girls.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: How's it goin', Buffy and Jodie? No response. The guys pass Randolf, the group's "leader", who eyes them with disdain. .

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: How's it goin', Randolf?

dialogues.speaker: RANDOLF
dialogues.text: (nods; superior) How's it goin', miscreants?

dialogues.speaker: S BILL
dialogues.text: Excellent. Thank you. Bill and Ted leave the group and continue toward school.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Bill, we're miscreants.

dialogues.speaker: BILL AND TED
dialogues.text: (beat) Excellent. AIR GUITAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted's locker is a total mess. There are no books; only junk food wrappers and Heavy Metal stickers. Ted stuffs his. rucksack in with all the other junk. A couple of lockers away, Bill uses the mirror which is attached to his locker door to study the progress of his scrawny little peach-fuzz moustache. s emu Ted. I totally have a most excellent moustache.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Ted is not paying attention; rather, he has focused h gaze on: BUFFY and JODIE, the two cheerleader types we just met, w now approach, chatting. They kneel down to their lockers, which are between and below Bill's and Ted's. Ted swallows, then turns to the girls.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Buffy. Excuse me. I would like to know if you would be my date for the San Dimas High Prom this weekend.

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: (“are you kidding") Thank you. No.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: (beat) Jodie. Excuse me. I would like to know if you would be my date for the San Dimas High Prom this. weekend.

dialogues.speaker: JODIE
dialogues.text: (giggling) No.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: (beat) Well...would either of you like to be Bill's date?

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY/JODIE
dialogues.text: No. | And the two pretty girls shut their lockers and walk away giggling.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Bill. Are there any other possible combinations I may have missed? But Bill is silent, engrossed in a piece of paper he has found in his locker. He turns toward Ted.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Dude. We are in big trouble.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: We have a history review session.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: When? The BELL RINGS. The guys look around. They are the only ones left in the hallway. As the guys amble away, Ted looks at his watch.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: How can school be startin' already? It's only five a.m. Bill looks at Ted's watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: a,

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Ted. You forgot to wind your watch. -

dialogues.speaker: TED -
dialogues.text: Oh. Yah. And as the guys turn the corner OUT OF FRAME, we: cuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: CHALKBOARD
dialogues.text: Listed on the board are four categories of history: “ANCIENT" "“MEDIEVAL" "MODERN" "“AMERICAN" Under each heading are listed several important FIGURES a MOVEMENTS from within that time period. (For instance, under "Ancient" are listed Rome, Greece, Egypt, etc.)

dialogues.text: Bill, I'm waiting ...

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: standing, facing the front of the room, totally confused.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Uh...short dude.

dialogues.speaker: TEACHER'S VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Anything else?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: (beat) He's dead? We HEAR snickering.

dialogues.speaker: CLASSROOM
dialogues.text: The teacher, MR. RYAN, a sincere and serious man in his forties, is in front of the chalkboard, pointing to the name “NAPOLEON BONAPARTE."

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: So then, Bill. You're telling me that Napoleon was, essentially, a "short, dead dude." Correct?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Well...Yah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More snickering from the class, especially Randolf, 0x,. Buffy and Jodie, who've been watching all this, entertained, from the front row.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Who's been drawing the "Wyld Stallyns" logo onto his desktop, looks up and laughs at his buddy.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: (sotto; to Bill) You totally blew it, dude!

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: hears this, and looks at Ted.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Alright, Ted. Why don't you stand up? Ted gulps, and stands. Ryan points to the board.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Who was Joan of Arc?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: (beat) Noah's wife? The class laughs.. Ryan sighs. The BELL RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: FRONT OF ROOM
dialogues.text: Bill and Ted stand at Mr. Ryan's desk.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Mr. Ryan, sir, before you say anything, my distinguished colleague, Ted, and I wish to express to you our thanks for all the things we have learned in your class.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: (looking at papers) Uh huh. And what have you learned?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: (improvising) We have learned that the world has a great history, and will continue to have a great history in the next one hundred years, of which we hope to be a part of, and which we sincerely hope you are as well. Ryan looks at Ted, who adds -- Ryan rips

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Yes, and that thanks to great leaders, such as Genghis Khan, Julius Caesar, and Socratic Method, the world is...full of history.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: It seems to me all you've learned is that... (glancing at papers) ...-Caesar is “a salad dressing dude." up the papers.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Bill. Ted. It's this simple. You've flunked every section of this class: Ancient History, Medieval History, Modern History, and American History. Bill and Ted stand silently.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: That means if you don't get an A+ on your final oral report tomorrow, I'll have no choice but to fail you. Now, you know your topics -- (he points to the chalkboard) “== and I would suggest that you cover at least those subjects if you want to pass. Understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill and Ted nod. Ryan looks back down at his papers. Then, as Bill and Ted turn to leave, Ryan looks up and adds:

dialogues.speaker: RYAN"
dialogues.text: And boys...your report had better be something very special. The guys gulp and we: cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill and Ted, loaded up with books, walk across campus. Bill looks at the paper that Mr. Ryan gave them.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Well, then, who was Noah's wife?

dialogues.speaker: BILL

dialogues.speaker: WORLD OF SAN DIMAS, 19877"
dialogues.text: (looks up from paper) We are in danger of flunking most heinously tomorrow, Ted. The guys look at each other and gulp. Then we HEAR:

dialogues.speaker: A GIRL'S VOICE, (0.S.)

dialogues.speaker: BILL

dialogues.speaker: BILL

dialogues.speaker: BILL

dialogues.speaker: OQ TED

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAMS

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAMS

dialogues.text: There is a nother sudden burst of MUSIC and LIGHT, and th guys turn around to see:

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER PHONE BOOTH
dialogues.text: dropping out of the sky and crashing onto the parking lot about 20 feet away from them. (This new booth looks exactly like Rufus' booth, only is much worse for the wea and appears to be jam-packed with people.) The guys look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Bill.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: What? ee TED = Strange things are afoot at the 7/11. Bill nods. Then the door to the new phone booth bursts open and:

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER BILL AND TED
dialogues.text: -- Exact replicas of our two guys in every way -- explode out of the booth and dash excitedly toward Billi and Ted.

dialogues.speaker: NEW BILL
dialogues.text: Dudes! You guys are gonna go back in time!

dialogues.speaker: NEW TED
dialogues.text: Yah! You are going to have a most excellent adventure through history! Bill and Ted are absolutely shocked.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Who are you guys?

dialogues.speaker: NEW TED
dialogues.text: We're you, dude!

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: No way. No way.

dialogues.speaker: NEW TED
dialogues.text: Yes way, Ted.

dialogues.speaker: NEW BILL
dialogues.text: We know how you feel -- we didn't believe it when we were you and we us said what we us are saying right now.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: (skeptical) Okay. Wait. If you're really us, what number are we thinking of?

dialogues.speaker: NEW BILL AND TED
dialogues.text: Sixty-nine, dudes! Beat. Bill and Ted gape at each other, amazed. Then they turn to New Bill and Ted, and all four crack up at the implications of this number, giving each other high fives and thumbs up. AIR GUITAR. Then:

dialogues.speaker: NEW BILL
dialogues.text: Listen dudes, we have to go.

dialogues.speaker: NEW TED
dialogues.text: Yah. We gotta get back to the history report. New Bill and Ted are about to head back to the booth when they notice Rufus, who has been watching all this, utterl nonplussed, from a few feet away.

dialogues.speaker: NEW TED
dialogues.text: Rufus! !

dialogues.speaker: NEW BILL
dialogues.text: Oh! Bill and Ted -- listen to this dude Rufus. He knows what he's talking about.

dialogues.speaker: NEW TED
dialogues.text: Right. And Ted -- give my love to the Princesses.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: NEW TED
dialogues.text: (grinning slyly) You'll see. . New Bill and New Ted pile back into their phone booth. Rufus joins them, and they confer for a moment. Then Rufu backs away and New Ted sticks his head out the booth,

dialogues.speaker: NEW TED
dialogues.text: Ted! Don't forget to wind your watch!

dialogues.speaker: NEW BILL
dialogues.text: Catch ya later, Bill and Ted!

dialogues.speaker: BILL AND TED
dialogues.text: stare, dumbfounded, as: the antenna on the second phone booth glows, then BLUE LIGHT shoots down the side, the ground below opens up, and in a FLASH of MUSIC and LIGHT, the phone booth disappears into the ground. Bill and Ted look at each other, then at Rufus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While Rufus flips through the phone book, Ted taps Bill o the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: (sotto) Dude. Are you sure we should be doing this?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Ted, you and I have witnessed many things, but nothing as bodacious as what just happened. Besides, we told ourselves to listen to this dude.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Maybe we were lying.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Why would we lie to ourselves, Ted? Ted thinks a beat, then nods, convinced. He turns to Rufus. 23  ©

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: How are you gonna help us, dude? Rufus lifts the receiver. The antenna rises out of the roof and begins to glow. .

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Are you gonna call someone and get the answers?

dialogues.speaker: RUFUS
dialogues.text: We're gonna do a lot better than than, gentlemen. Rufus begins dialing. With each number, we HEAR corresponding HEAVY METAL GUITAR CHORD. Bill and Ted respond to this.

dialogues.speaker: BILL/TED
dialogues.text: Excellent. The booth begins to glow with bluish light.

dialogues.speaker: RUFUS
dialogues.text: Brace yourself, amigos.

dialogues.speaker: RUFUS
dialogues.text: Gentlemen ... we're history. There is a sudden FLASH of BRILLIANT WHITE LIGHT, a ROAR HEAVY METAL MUSIC, and ...

dialogues.speaker: THE PHONE BOOTH
dialogues.text: disappears into the ground with a WHOOSH. cur TO: THE “CIRCUITS OF TIME" A complex system cf wires and circuits criss-crossing the SCREEN. After a beat, we HEAR:

dialogues.speaker: BILL/TED, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Whoocoaaaaa! !!!! . And the phone booth shoots INTO FRAME, diving into one of the opaque tube-like CIRCUITS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill and Ted, eyes wide and amazed, peer through the glas as the booth barrels down the circuit wire on a virtual roller-coaster ride through time.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Rufus! Where are we, dude?!

dialogues.speaker: RUFUS
dialogues.text: These are the circuits of history, gentlemen. They'll take you almost anywhere you want to go. At any time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?!

dialogues.speaker: RUFUS
dialogues.text: (smiles). Modern technology, William. The booth makes a sudden sharp drop OUT OF PRAME and we: cuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large, grassy plateau, overlooking a broad valley. We HEAR a pounding chord of HEAVY METAL MUSIC, the sky opens up, there is a FLASH OF LIGHT, and --

dialogues.speaker: THE PHONE BOOTH
dialogues.text: drops from the opening in the sky and drops onto the plateau. Some junk food wrappers from the 7/11 flutter down behind it as the sky closes back up. After a beat, Bill and Ted step out of the booth and look around, very excited.

dialogues.speaker: BILL/TED
dialogues.text: Whoaaaa!!

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: That was most unprecedented, Rufus.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: (nods) Yah -- but where are we, dude?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 26 Rufus calmly glances at the phone book.

dialogues.speaker: RUFUS
dialogues.text: France. 1804. Bill and Ted's mouths drop open. Suddenly a CANNON BLAST is HEARD and the guys look down into --

dialogues.speaker: THE VALLEY BELOW
dialogues.text: where two opposing brigades af SOLDIERS have launched int battle.

dialogues.speaker: BILL AND TED
dialogues.text: could not be more thrilled.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Bill, check it out! We're right in the middle of a war!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {waving at the armies below) Up here, dudes! A BULLET whizzes past Bill's ear. Ted laughs, pointing at Bill's head.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: (calling down) Just missed, dude!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rufus notices a group of SOLDIERS on a nearby bluff.

dialogues.speaker: RUFUS
dialogues.text: Time to depart, amigos. Bill and Ted nod as --

dialogues.speaker: THE GROUP OF SOLDIERS
dialogues.text: looks their way. At the head of the group, in command, is a small, arrogan FRENCH GENERAL. The General lifts a pair of field glasses to his face and gazes across the plateau.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His Pe 4m PHONE BOOTH As Rufus dials, Bill and Ted peer out in the General's direction and wave. We can read their lips as they say:

dialogues.speaker: BILL/TED
dialogues.text: How's it goin', dude?

dialogues.speaker: THE GENERAL
dialogues.text: pusts down his field glasses and is shaking his head wiie an_EXPLOSION goes off behind him, tossing the General through the air and onto the ground right next to the now lowin hone booth. Suddenly the ground opens and both the booth and the General are sucked down into the hole! The ground closes up and we: cUuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: THE CIRCUITS OF TIME
dialogues.text: The phone booth bombs PAST CAMERA, an excited AIR GUITAR emanating from within. It is soon followed by the terrified General, hair shooting straight back, arms flailing wildly as he barrels down the tube behind the booth. As the General hurtles PAST and OUT OF FRAME, we: cuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a FLASH OF LIGHT and the Phone Booth suddenly drops onto the front lawn next to a large oak tree. Bill, Ted, and Rufus pile out, none of them noticing that

dialogues.speaker: ABOVE THEM
dialogues.text: is dangling by his collar on a branch of the oak tree, looking like a cat held up by the scruff of its neck.

dialogues.speaker: BILL AND TED
dialogues.text: look around the yard, elated. (Throughout the following w are occasionally aware of two FEET which helplessly dangl

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: C Now where are we?! — (beat) Oh. It's my house.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Rufus -- can we go anyplace we want? At any time?

dialogues.speaker: RUFUS
dialogues.text: (nods) You can do whatever you want, gentlemen, as long as you ’ remember this: No matter what happens, you have to get to the report. Got it? The guys nod.

dialogues.speaker: RUFUS
dialogues.text: The report's tomorrow at 2:45, right? They nod again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: : Okay then, amigos... {re: phone book) This'1l1l tell you the number of whatever place you want to go. Rufus points to the numbers on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: RUFUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Just dial the area and the time. (re: a "special" button) And this is what activates the time travel function.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: RUFUS
dialogues.text: Quite simple, William. Through a retroactive cross- referencing of the intralateral continuum ... C ) Rufus stops, noticing that Bill and Ted are totally l

dialogues.speaker: RUFUS
dialogues.text: Trust me, gentlemen. It works. (then) Now remember, amigos: No matter where you go, or what you do, that clock -- (re; Ted's watch) the clock in San Dimas -- is always running. Got it? Ted nods and looks at his watch. Bill looks at the phone book. Rufus bows his head and takes a step back.

dialogues.speaker: RUFUS
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, it's time for me to leave you now. Bill and Ted look at Rufus, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, Rufus?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Yah. Aren't you coming with us? Rufus backs into the phone booth and shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: RUFUS
dialogues.text: William. Theodore ... You're on your own. Bill and Ted watch, wide-eyed, as Rufus closes the door a dials. We HEAR the same great heavy metal chords, and then, in a FLASH of LIGHT -- -- the booth disappears. A split second later, there is another FLASH and it reappears, empty. Bill and Ted look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: _ Ted.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: This has been a most unusual day. And as Ted nods in agreement, we HEAR a branch breaking above and --

dialogues.speaker: THE FRENCH GENERAL
dialogues.text: falls from the tree and lands on his feet right in front them. He looks around, mutters something in French, then topples to the ground, unconscious.

dialogues.speaker: BILL AND TED
dialogues.text: are astounded.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Dude ... we saw that guy in France.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: (shaking his head) And just when we thought things couldn't get any more bodacious ...

dialogues.speaker: A MOMENT LATER
dialogues.text: Bill and Ted are standing over the unconscious General, Bill frantically flipping through his history book.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: So who is he? Bill stops and looks at the book.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Ted ... it's Napoleon.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Who's that?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: You know -- the short dead dude from our history review!

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Whoa! Excellent! (to the unconscious General) Hey, you're famous, dude!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 31 Bill snaps closed the history book and turns to his buddy

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Ted ... I have a most excellent idea!! And on Bill's excitement we: cur TO: INT. TED'S BEDROOM - CLOSE ON LITTLE Boy Ted's little brother, DEACON, nine years old and bored, listens as Ted explains the plan.

dialogues.speaker: TED, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Deacon. You have to watch this guy. His name is Napoleon. He is a very famous French dude. PULL BACK TO REVEAL the rest of Ted's bedroom. It's a total mess; covered with scrawled drawings, empty junk-fo wrappers and tons of Heavy Metal paraphernalia. Napoleon lays unconscious on Ted's bed.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: We have decided to collect other speakers from history for a oral report we are doing. While we are gone, you are not to let him out of your sight. Ted hands Deacon some money.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Here is some money. Take him to the movies or something. Napoleon starts to come to. He looks around, baffled and bit angry. Bill notices him.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Napoleon, dude. I am Bill. We will take you back to France after you tell us what you think of San Dimas. This is Ted's brother Deacon.

dialogues.speaker: DEACON
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: He will take care of you. (then) Ready Ted?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Ready, Bill.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Let's go back into history! A quick AIR GUITAR, and the guys dash out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill and Ted, very excited, are bounding out the front do when Captain Williams suddenly steps INTO FRAME, blocking Ted's path.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: I want to speak with you, son. Bill attempts to re-enter the house.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: Alone, please, Bill. And Ted gulps as Williams slams the door shut,

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Alone. Silent. Lost. After a beat, he. leans against the door and presse up to it. His face goes ashen as he HEARS:

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAMS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (mid-lecture) -«. you lose my keys, you fail history, you spend all your time with your loser friend, planning a band that'll never happen.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: Now you're not to leave this house again until tomorrow morning. leaving -- s his ear The PHONE RINGS. Williams crosses and picks it up. 32

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: VOICE ON PHONE
dialogues.text: Uh, Captian Williams, this is Officer Van Halen down at the station.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: Officer Van Halen...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill stands, receiver in hand, heavily disguising his voice.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: I'm new, dude -- sir. Listen. We found your keys. If you want 'em, better come and get ‘em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Williams hangs up, shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: When I get back from the station, I want you packed and ready to go. Got it?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: (quietly) Yes, sir. Captain Williams turns and heads upstairs. As he does, th front door opens, and Bill sticks his head inside. Ted erosses to hin.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Dude, we are in serious trouble. My dad already signed me up. My plane leaves tomorrow night.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: (beat) But that's only if we fail, dude. A moment. The guys look at each other. Then, slowly, their gaze shifts outside, toward the phone booth. The guys brighten and turn back to each other.

dialogues.speaker: BILL/TED
dialogues.text: No way!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted reads from the history checklist, while Bill flips through the phone book.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: (mispronouncing everything) So-crates. Sigmund Freud. Beethoven.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: (referring to phone book) Is there one for 'The Western Movement in America in the nineteenth century'?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: (checking list) Yah.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: (excited) Well then, let's reach out and touch someone, dude! AIR GUITAR. Then Bill dials, the GUITAR CHORDS resonating through the booth. Then Bill gets a connection. We HEAR a drum beat, and the guys look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Bill, my friend?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Yes, Ted, my friend?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: May we have a most excellent adventure! Bill and Ted firmly shake hands, and in a FLASH of MUSIC and LIGHT, the booth disappears. A beat later, Captain Williams exits the house, heading toward his car, and we:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rough, tough, prospecting town, somewhere in the Colora Territory. We HEAR HEAVY METAL GUITAR and shortly thereafter --

dialogues.speaker: THE PHONE BOOTH
dialogues.text: drops out of the sky and lands next to a row of OUTHOUSES A few confused TOWNSPEOPLE stare as Bill and Ted step out of the booth and look around, very excited. A beat, then:

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: How's it goin', Old West dudes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A real Old West-style barroom. A piano plays in the background. Bill and Ted enter and saunter up to the bar.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: (to bartender) Two beers, please.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: (sotto; to Bill) Whoa, he didn't even card us.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Yah, we have to remember this place. The bartender hands them drinks. Bill and Ted look around the saloon.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Well, Ted, who should we take back with us?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: How about that guy? He's a total Old-West ugly dude. An UGLY COWBOY glares at Bill and Ted.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: (to Cowboy; smiling) How would you like to be ina history report?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: We already have Napoleon “signed up.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: (growling) Where the hell are you from?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: San Dimas.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Home of Raging Waters, excellent water slides. Suddenly a GUNSHOT rings out and all attention shifts to:

dialogues.speaker: THE SWINGING DOORS
dialogues.text: where a tough-looking YOUNG COWBOY enters and begins walking around the saloon, staring at everyone. He stops in front of Bill and Ted. Silence. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: How's it goin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Young Cowboy moves away from Bill and Ted, addresses everyone in the saloon.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG COWBOY
dialogues.text: I need two men. Who's with me?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: (sotto; to Bartender) Who's he?

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: (nervously) Billy the Kid.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: (to Ted) He's famous. Let's nab him. TED . We're with you, Billy the Kid!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C) he 37

dialogues.speaker: THE SALOON
dialogues.text: Goes back to normal as Billy the Kid steps up to the bar and warily eyes Bill and Ted.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY THE KID
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: We have a band --

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: -- Of outlaws. I'm Bill Wyld.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: I'm...Stallyn Ted.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY THE KID
dialogues.text: I've never heard of you.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: You will --

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: -- We're totally gonna open for Iron Maiden! AIR GUITAR, which is interrupted by Billy the Kid, who throws Bill and Ted against the bar.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY THE KID
dialogues.text: Here's the deal. What I win, I keep. Bill and Ted nod.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY THE KID
dialogues.text: What you win...I keep.

dialogues.speaker: BILL/TED
dialogues.text: (shrug) Sounds good, Mr. the Kid. Billy the Kid looks at them, and on his reaction we: cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: THE CARD GAME
dialogues.text: A bunch of grizzled, hard-boiled COWBOYS scowl AT CAMERA. None of them have much money on the table and all of them look pissed.

dialogues.speaker: AC. .35 THE TABLE
dialogues.text: Sit Bill, Ted and Billy the Kid. Bill and Ted have huge piles ‘of money in frent of them. So does Billy the Kid, who's dealing. : Ted gapes happily as he looks at his hand. 8111 nudges him.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: {sotto; to Ted) Dude. You gotta have a poker face, like me. Bill picks up his hand.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: (excited) Whoa! Three aces! Billy the Kid glares at Bill.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: turns to the large TATTOOED COWBOY next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto) We're totally cheating you, dude. (off the Cowboy's look) But it's okay -- you'll get your money back as soon as we bag Billy the Kid.

dialogues.speaker: THE COWBOYS
dialogues.text: look at each cther, fed up. They put their cards down and stand, glowering at Billy the Kid.

dialogues.speaker: BEARDED COWBOY
dialogues.text: What the hell is going on here, Billy?

dialogues.speaker: OLD WEST UGLY DUDE
dialogues.text: You cheatin' us, Kid?

dialogues.speaker: BILLY THE KID
dialogues.text: Cheatin? Me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 39 The cewboys reach for their guns, but before they can -- -- Billy the Kid grabs the money, knocks the table over, and punches the Old West Ugly Dude. Suddenly --

dialogues.speaker: THE SALOON
dialogues.text: Clears out. The brawl is on.

dialogues.speaker: BILL AND TED
dialogues.text: Sit rooted to their chairs, gaping at the melee developin around them. Bottles and bullets whiz past their heads. Tables and chairs are overturned and broken. The guys look at each other and are about to do a thrille AIR GUITAR when they are grabbed and pulled out OPPOSITE SIDES OF FRAME. The PIANO continues in the background as:

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: lands on a table and looks around. Three very large, very ugly, very nasty-looking RUSTLERS glare at him.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: How's it goin', big ugly dudes? Silence. The rustlers look like they're about to tear Ted's heart out. Ted swallows.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Qkay, look. I gotta be honest with you guys: I'm totally weak. I can't possibly fight you. A beat. Then Ted pulls a small paper booklet from his pocket and opens it.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: However, how would you gentlemen like free passes to see "The Song Remains The Same" at the San Dimas 67 But before Ted can tear the tickets out, the rustlers gra him.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: I didn't think so. Meanwhile --

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Is behind the bar, jumping tack and forth to avoid the whiskey bottles that are now being chucked at him. A bottle whizzes past his ear and crashes against the mirror, shattering it. Bill gives the thumbs-up sign.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Nice shot, dude! Another barrage of bottles drives Bill to --

dialogues.speaker: THE FLOOR
dialogues.text: Where he crawls behind the bar. He sees a shard of the broken mirror, picks it up, and checks the progress of hi moustache.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: (pleased, winking at himself) Excellent 'stache, Smith. Then Bill reacts as he sees --

dialogues.speaker: IN THE MIRROR
dialogues.text: The reflection of a BIG BEARDED COWBOY grinning evilly ba at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bearded Cowboy reaches down with one hand, picks Bill up, and holds him over his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three Rustlers are tossing Ted around like a beach ball. .

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: How's it goin', Ted?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: (mid-air) Excellent. You?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Outstanding. The Big Bearded Cowboy suddenly huris Bill through the ai while -- .

dialogues.speaker: THE RUSTLERS
dialogues.text: Grab Ted and hurl him through the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several DANCE HALL GIRLS are watching the fight when -- -- BILL'S HEAD comes crashing through the wall of the saloon, followed shortly by TED'S HEAD, which crashes through right next to Bill's. The two guys turn and see each other.

dialogues.speaker: BILL/TED
dialogues.text: Whoa! !

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: (laughing) You totally got thrown through the wall, dude! Ted looks around and notices the provocatively dressed girls in front of him. He turns on the charm:

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: How's it goin' ladies? I am Ted T. Williams, and this is my friend, Bill Ss. -- But before he can finish, the guys are pulied back throug the wall. The Dance Hall Girls look at each other and we are back in:

dialogues.speaker: THE SALOON
dialogues.text: Where we see that it was Billy the Kid who grabbed the guys. :

dialogues.speaker: BILLY THE KID
dialogues.text: c'mon! Billy the Kid turns and dashes across the room where he runs directly into:

dialogues.speaker: THE CARD PLAYING COWBOYS
dialogues.text: who quickly surround him and draw their guns.

dialogues.speaker: O
dialogues.text: duck behind a wall and look at each other. TED . Bill. We gotta save hin.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Yah. But how? A beat, Ted peeks around the wall and looks at the line-u of cowboys, then nudges Bill -~

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Check it out. . And he points at --

dialogues.speaker: THE COWBOYS' UNDERWEAR
dialogues.text: All of which is barely sticking out the tops of their pants.

dialogues.speaker: BILL AND TED
dialogues.text: Look at each other and smile. They creep out from behind the wall and stop just behind the Cowboys.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: (sotto) Ready, Bill?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: (sotto) Ready, Ted.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: One - two - three --

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Go!! And the guys suddenly pull each of the Cowboys' long underwear up, giving them “Melvins." They follow this by _pantsind” the Cowboys -- pulling the pants down around their knees As the confused Cowboys stagger around, trying to tug the \ long underwear down and their pants up, Bill and Ted kn ‘J the guns out of their hands, then "high-five" each oth

dialogues.speaker: CO TED
dialogues.text: " Good goin, Bill Wyld!

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: You too, Stallyn Ted! And as the Cowboys continue to struggle with their pants, Bill, Ted and Billy the Kid dash out of the saloon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy the Kid looks at the guys as they rush away from th saloon and toward the phone booth.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY THE KID
dialogues.text: You two saved my life.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Nothin' doin', Billy the Kid. The guys push through the line which is waiting to use th outhouse.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Excuse us, dudes, we gotta use the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They reach the booth, squeezing past a Cowboy who exits t booth, zipping up his fly. Bill and Ted look down.

dialogues.speaker: BILL/TED
dialogues.text: Oh, no...

dialogues.speaker: BILLY THE KID
dialogues.text: (re: the booth) Where we going? Ted glances at the history checklist.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: "The Golden Age of Civilization."

dialogues.speaker: BILLY THE KID
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: (dialing) Ancient Greece, dude! (_) The HEAVY METAL CHORDS begin to pound and the booth b OS to shake.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY THE KID
dialogues.text: What the -- ? TED © Don't worry, Billy the Kid. We'll bring you back here as soon as you talk at our report.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Believe me, dude, Napoleon has it tougher. He's back in San Dimas with Ted's little brother, Deacon. Ted looks at his watch. It reads 7:15 P.M. There is a FLASH and we: cUuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A clock on the outside wall reads 7:15 P.M.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN ACROSS people eating. corner table -- Children, parents and, at a Deacon, his nine year old girlfriend, KERRY, her eight ye old friend, DAPHNE...and Napoleon. This is a double date. There is a sudden clamorous RINGING OF BELLS and Napoleon reacts, startled, as a WAITER rushes up with a huge “TROUGH". Napoleon stares as the immense dish of ice crea is set before hin. AS ANOTHER WAITER places a "gag bib" on him, we: cuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: THE TABLE
dialogues.text: The "kids" are all finishing making a quick move to scoop cream away from Daphne) when BELLS and the Waiter pins an off the Trough (Napoleon the last bit of chocolate ice there is another RINGING OF "I_Made a Pig of Myself at Farrells" button onto Napoleon, next to his other medals. Napoleon looks around, angered and confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 45 We notice that the clock on the wall behind him now reads 7:57 P.M., as we: cuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ancient pillars. Greek statues. A phone booth.

dialogues.speaker: BILL AND TED
dialogues.text: amble along a tree-lined path.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: How we doin' with the time?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: (looking at his watch) Excellent.

dialogues.speaker: WATCH
dialogues.text: Which now reads only 7:45 P.M. We notice that the second hand is beginning to Siow down as -- :

dialogues.speaker: THE GUYS
dialogues.text: steal up to:

dialogues.speaker: A SMALL AMPITHEATRE UP AHEAD
dialogues.text: Where a group of five or six YOUNG MEN are seated ‘around one OLDER MAN. The Older Man, short and rotund, appears t be “holding court". One of the students uses the name "Socrates" to address t older man.

dialogues.speaker: BILL, TED AND BILLY THE KID
dialogues.text: Crouch nearby. BILL . Socrates? Hey -- we know that name.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Yah. Look him up. (helpfully) It's under So-crates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 46 Bill finds the right passage in the book. Ted looks over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: (reading) “The only true wisdom consists in knowing that you know nothing." The guys look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: That's us, dude.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: (nods) Let's bag him. They guys start off, then stop, noticing Billy the Kid, w obviously wants to go with them. Ted rummages through his rucksack and removes a Nerf football, which he tosses to the confused young cowboy.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Here, Billy the Kid. This is a Nerf football. You can play . with it while we talk to So- crates and nothing will get hurt.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE AMPITHEATRE
dialogues.text: Bill and Ted join the group. Everyone quiets down, all eyes on the oddly dressed newcomers. There is some puzzle murmuring, some laughing. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: How's it goin'? Socrates looks at Bill and Ted, quite curious. There is silence in the group. Another beat.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: (sotto) Ted. He's waitin’ for you to say something. .

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: (sotto) What do I say?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: (shrugging) Philosophize with him.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: (shrugs; to Socrates) "All we are is dust in the wind", dude.

dialogues.speaker: SOCRATES
dialogues.text: He scratches his head, intrigued. We HEAR Heavy Metal chords, there is a blinding FLASH OF LIGHT and we:

dialogues.speaker: A BOWLING BALL
dialogues.text: smashing into a set of bowling pins.

dialogues.speaker: SCORESHEET
dialogues.text: PAN DOWN NAMES: Deacon, Kerry, Daphne, Napoleon. We are in the tenth frame of the third game. The kids' scores average between 70 and 100. Napoleon's high is 43. Suddenly Napoleon's score changes to 143 as -=

dialogues.speaker: THE LITTLE GENERAL
dialogues.text: (now wearing green and red bowling shoes) cheats on his score, then rises to bowl. Behind his back, Deacon, Kerry, and Daphne roll their eye They hate him. Deacon imitates his awkward style as Napoleon rolls a gutter ball and scowls, ranting arrogant at a family which bowls next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind Napoleon, the kids whisper to each other and giggl planning something. Meanwhile, Napoleon's ball comes back and he bowls again, tossing another gutter. ball. This time he throws a littl fit of poor sportsmanship: stomping his feet, shaking his fist in the air, and then, finally, pounding his fist on the air jet, and hurting his wrist in the process. Trying to ease the pain, Napoleon places his hand inside his coat, thus striking the famous "pose" for the first time. .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 43 Then, Napoleon turns around to find -- The kids are gone. Napoleon attempts to run after then, but is quickly blocked by --

dialogues.speaker: THE ALLEY MANAGER
dialogues.text: A fat, sweaty, ineffectual man in his fifties.

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER
dialogues.text: Hey -- not so fast, there, buddy. You ain't paid yet! Napoleon stares at him, uncomprehending.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a beat, Napoleon is booted out the door. He stumble down onto the pavement.

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER
dialogues.text: I don't wanna see you around here anymore. Beat it. Napoleon, confused, stands, brushes himself off, curses a the Manager, and then stumbles away, having no idea where to go or what to do, Meanwhile --

dialogues.speaker: DOWN THE STREET
dialogues.text: The three kids bolt away.

dialogues.speaker: KERRY
dialogues.text: Your brother'1] kill you!

dialogues.speaker: DEACON
dialogues.text: I don't care. Napoleon's a dick. They turn a corner, giggling, and we: cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the outskirts of this grey stone castle, a babbling brook winds its way through a verdant field. A beaten-dow looking SERF (we'll call him JOHN) is bent over, picking roots when -- The phone booth crashes to the ground right next to him.  ©

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4g A beat later, Bill, Ted, Billy the Kid and Socrates step out. Socrates looks around, amazed. Billy the Kid flips Nerf football into the air.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY THE KID
dialogues.text: Not bad, huh, So-crates? (to Bill) Where are we, dude?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: England. 1371.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: {looking at his watch) Dude, we are in most excellent shape for our history report.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Yah. Alls we need is one more speaker, from Medieval.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY THE KID
dialogues.text: (pointing to John the Serf) How 'bout that guy?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: (nods; impressed) Iomust say, Billy the Kid, you are dealing with the oddity of time traveling with the greatest of ease. Billy the Kid smiles proudly as Bill approaches John the Serf.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Excuse me, dude. Where would we find personages of historical significance around here? John the Serf looks up at Bill and smiles toothlessly.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: (beat) Later. Bill crosses to Ted. In the BACKGROUND, Billy the Kid and Socrates flip the Nerf football back and forth.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: O So, Ted, any ideas on who should we bag? Ted? / But Tea is spellbound, speechless.

dialogues.speaker: TED'S POV
dialogues.text: Two beautiful young PRINCESSES are standing on the castle balcony, looking out. One of them, JOANNA, has made eye contact with --

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: who is smitten.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: I'm in love, dude.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: (nods) Those must be the Princesses you told yourself about at the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T/il. (then) * Well ... You're the ladies! “ man, how're we gonna meet ‘em?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark. Shadowy. Suits of armor line the wall. Several royal Henchman walk by, on patrol. They continue OUT OF FRAME. Beat. Then we HEAR:

dialogues.speaker: TED'S VOICE
dialogues.text: {echoing) Bill.

dialogues.speaker: BILL'S VOICE
dialogues.text: (same) What?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: These are heavy.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Yah. Heavy metal!! Loud, echoing AIR GUITAR, as two of the suits of armor st VD out of the shadows and start to clank around.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: I feel like the dude in the Wizard of Oz.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: The straw dude?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: No, not that dude. Bill does a heavy, clanking "jig".

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: (singing) "Tf I only had a heart..."

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Way to go, dude! As Bill and Ted turn down the hallway, we SEE that their boxers are coming up out of their suits. As they clank clumsily away from us: .

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Bill?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: (low, breathy) Use the Force, Bill. I'm Darth Ted. Ted grabs a lance off the wall and swings it at Bill. It connects with a thud. Then Bill pushes Ted, playfully, and Ted pushes back. The begin to roughhouse, knocking each other onto the floor, wrestling, laughing, and hitting each other. Neither pays the slightest attention to the incredible amount of noise they're making.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill shoves Ted backwards, falling back himself, and knocking Ted rolling down a small flight of stairs. We HEAR Ted hit the bottom of the stairs with a tremendou CRASH. Then Bill crawls out of his suit of armor, stands, and looks down the stairs at --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TED'S SU.f OF ARMOR which lays on the floor, motionless. TWO HENCHMEN stand over it, swords drawn. The Henchmen plunge the swords into the suit, look around for the other “intruder,” and run off in the opposite direction.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Horrified, slowly moves down the stairs and stands over Ted's suit of armor, fighting tears. He can barely speak.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Bogus...Heinous...Non- triumphant... He collapses to his knees in front of the suit of armor.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Aw, Ted. Don't be dead, dude. A long, heartbreaking moment as Bill takes the suit's han and shakes it.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: S'long, Ted. (overcome) I...love you, dude. (quickly; to himself) Fag. Then we HEAR footsteps, and Bill turns and sees yet ANOTH HENCHMAN approaching, sword drawn.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: (fiercely) You killed Ted, you Medieval dick-weed! Possessed with a terrible vengeance, Bill charges the Henchman and knocks him into the wall, punching and kicki at hin.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Aaaaaaauuuuuugggggghhhhhh!!!!! Bill is pushed to the floor by the far more powerful Henchman. He is about to be run through when --

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Steps out from the shadows and belts the Henchman with hi lance, felling him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill looks up in astonishment.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Ted, you're alive!

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Yah! I flew out of my suit when I hit the floor. Bill gets up and the guys rush to each other. They hug. Beat. They realize what they're doing and separate.

dialogues.speaker: BOTH
dialogues.text: (to the other) Fag. cut To:

dialogues.speaker: A DOOR
dialogues.text: which OPENS, revealing JOANNA and ELIZABETH, the two beautiful Princesses we saw earlier. Joanna's eyes widen.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: You're the ones we saw in the garden.

dialogues.speaker: BILL AND TED
dialogues.text: Ted nods, enraptured.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: T am Ted of San Dimas, and I bring to you a message of love.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: (pleased) ‘ From who?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: From ... (thinks) ++. myself, 53

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: (sotto) Way to go, dude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joanna moves closer toward Ted.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: And what is this message you speak of? Ted is stumped.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Uh...

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: (sotte) Lyrics, dude! Recite them some lyrics! Ted clears his throat, and improvises.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: “Oh; you beautiful babes from ‘England, For whom we have traveled through time. Will you go to the prom with us in San Dimas? We will have a most triumphant time."

dialogues.speaker: THE PRINCESSES
dialogues.text: are pleased. Then, suddenly, we HEAR:

dialogues.speaker: AN ANGRY VOICE
dialogues.text: (from down the corridor) Joanna! Elizabeth! The Princesses stiffen.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: It's Pather! They grab Bill and Ted and hurriedly usher them --

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: What does he want? 54

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: We're to be married to two horrible old men today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way! The Princesses nod urgently.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Will you help us escape?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: (puffing up with bravado) * Of course, babes! But as ‘the guys gallantly turn around, they find themsel face to face with:

dialogues.speaker: THE DUKE
dialogues.text: who is flanked by two OLD FAT MEN and several GUARDS. He is furious.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: How's it goin', Duke-dude? I am the Earl of Smith.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: And I am the Duke of Ted.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Your, daughters do not love these two old fat dudes.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Yah, but we do. That is -- we love your daughters, not the two old fat dudes.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Put them in the Iron Maiden!

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Iron Maiden?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Excellent! AIR GUITAR. The Duke is outraged.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Execute them!

dialogues.speaker: BILL/TED
dialogues.text: Bogus. . The Princesses gasp, horrified, as the Duke's Henchmen gr Bill and Ted and drag them away.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: {calling back) Don't worry, babes -- we'll save you!

dialogues.speaker: TWO HUGE, RAZOR-SHARP AXES
dialogues.text: violently crashing down onto two chopping blocks. The axe are raised and --

dialogues.speaker: BILL'S AND TED'S HEADS
dialogues.text: are lowered INTO FRAME, onto the blocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEALS that we are in the middle of a ROYAL COURTYARD. The Duke, the Princesses, the two Old Fat Men, and numero Henchmen are gathered to watch Bill and Ted get beheaded. Several hours have passed -- it's now early evening.

dialogues.speaker: THE GUYS
dialogues.text: look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Bill.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: I believe our adventure through time has taken a most serious turn. Bill nods as --

dialogues.speaker: THE DUKE
dialogues.text: stands and, with an imperious gesture, motions to --

dialogues.speaker: THE BLACK-HOODED EXECUTIONERS
dialogues.text: who poise their huge axes over the guys' heads. The crowd hushes. The Princesses fight tears. Then, suddenly -- q

dialogues.speaker: THE EXECUTIONERS
dialogues.text: bring down their axes and --

dialogues.speaker: BILL AND TED
dialogues.text: wince, then open their eyes when they realize that -- THE EXECUTIONERS.” have not beheaded them, but have, instead, severed their bonds!! Then the Executioners remove their hoods, REVEALING that they are not, in fact, executioners -- but are rather BIL THE KID and SOCRATES!

dialogues.speaker: THE COURTYARD
dialogues.text: erupts into chaos! The Princesses' eyes widen. The Duke, outraged, dispatches a bunch of Henchmen to kill --

dialogues.speaker: BILL AND TED
dialogues.text: who leap up from the chopping blocks.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: So-crates! Billy the Kid! Socrates winks at Bill. Billy the Kid taps his gun.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY THE KID
dialogues.text: You saved my life, I saved yours.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Way to go, dude! They all exchange a quick high-five. Then Bill notices th Henchmen closing in fast.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Let's go! As they turn and rush away:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ne

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: {looks back) What about the babes?! Bill glances back at --

dialogues.speaker: THE PRINCESSES
dialogues.text: who are completely surrounded by Guards.

dialogues.speaker: BILL AND TED
dialogues.text: as they near the wall of the castle, Henchmen in hot pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: There's nothing we can do!

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Ted. We got no choice. We'll have to come back for 'em after the report. They reach the end of the courtyard and begin to scale th stone wall. Henchmen draw nearer as Billy the Kid gives Socrates a "boost" over the wall, then scrambles over with Bill. Whe Ted reaches the top, he stops and looks back at:

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: who smiles and blows a kiss at him just before --

dialogues.speaker: A HENCHMAN'S ARROW
dialogues.text: embeds itself in the wall just below Ted. More arrows fly past and Ted is driven over onto:

dialogues.speaker: THE OTHER SIDE OF THE WALL
dialogues.text: where he joins the other guys as they run for their life toward the phone booth.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: (catching up) Bill -- I just realized. We don't got a Medieval speaker for the report. What are we gonna do??

dialogues.speaker: BILLY THE KID
dialogues.text: Zi took care of that.

dialogues.speaker: BILL/TED
dialogues.text: What?? . Billy the Kid nods and points --

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE BOOTH
dialogues.text: Where JOHN THE SERF, flipping the Nerf Football up and down, grins toothlessly at them.

dialogues.speaker: THE HEAVILY ARMED HENCHMEN
dialogues.text: begin to scale the wall as --

dialogues.speaker: BILL, TED, SOCRATES AND BILLY THE KID
dialogues.text: all pile into the phone booth with John the Serf. Needles to say, it's getting a bit crowded in here. Bill grabs the phone book and begins rifling through it a a flaming arrow smacks against the booth. Ted peers through the glass at the quickly approaching Henchmen,

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Bill ... I think we better get going. Bill -- what are doing, dude?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: I'm trying to find the number to San Dimas! -- There. But, just as Bill gets a good look at the number --

dialogues.speaker: A FLAMING ARROW
dialogues.text: sails into the booth and lodges directly into the phone book! The book's brittle pages burst into flame!

dialogues.speaker: BILL/TED
dialogues.text: Whoaaa! !

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Put it out, dude!

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: I'm trying -- owww! Dude, I can't! We'll hafta do without it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: wad

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 60 Bill tosses the burning book from the booth and Ted pulls the door shut as --

dialogues.speaker: THE HENCHMEN
dialogues.text: approach the booth. At the head of the group stalks.a ferocious seven foot MOUNTAIN OF FLESH, swinging an immen spiked ball and chain over his head.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BOOTH
dialogues.text: Bill dials frantically.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: What are you dialing, dude?!

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: San Dimas. Hold on. Bill finishes dialing. An arrow careens off the antenna.. There is a CLICK. The guys look at each other expectantly and we HEAR:

dialogues.speaker: A PRE-RECORDED VOICE
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, the number you have dialed is not in service at this time. Please check your directory and dial again. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: BILL/TED
dialogues.text: Oh, no! Suddenly the booth begins to rock as the Henchman begin pounding on the side of it. Billy the Kid and Socrates struggle to hold the door shut. Bill, panicky, redials, a Ted notices that:.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE BOOTH
dialogues.text: The Henchmen have given way to the seven-foot GIANT who i now snarling ferociously, fiercely swinging the ball and chain over his head.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: C'mon, dude! He's gonna -- !!

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: I know, Ted! There is another CLICK and the guys cross their fingers a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The antenna pops out of the roof and begins to spark. We HEAR HEAVY METAL CHORDS, there is a FLASH of LIGHT, and, just as --

dialogues.speaker: THE HUGE HENCHMAN
dialogues.text: swings the spiked ball against the booth --

dialogues.speaker: THE GROUND
dialogues.text: opens with a WHOOSH and --

dialogues.speaker: THE BOOTH
dialogues.text: Grops into it causing --

dialogues.speaker: TRE HENCHMAN'S BALL
dialogues.text: to MISS the booth but CONNECT with the sparking antenna, bendin t backwards just as --

dialogues.speaker: THE BOOTH
dialogues.text: disappears into the darkness and -- THE GROUND . closes back up. HOLD for a beat on the confused Henchmen, then:

dialogues.speaker: THE CIRCUITS OF TIME
dialogues.text: The phone booth shoots PAST CAMERA, MUSIC blaring from within, sparks shooting from the damaged antenna.

dialogues.speaker: TED, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Where we goin', dude?

dialogues.speaker: BILL, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Home, I hope!! The careening booth dives down a chute and we:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same vast, orangeish desert we saw in the opening. Great heavy metal MUSIC emanates from each of the futuristic domes which dot the landscape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We HEAR voices, and a moment later, the sky opens up and phone booth crashes down onto the ground. The skewed ante recedes back into the roof as Bill and Ted pull themselve the booth and look around, baffled.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: ‘ Dude, this is not San Dimas. Bill nods. The guys notice the domes.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Excellent music.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Most outstanding. Then, the guys' attention shifts to:

dialogues.speaker: ONE OF THE DOMES
dialogues.text: where’ a WOMAN, dressed all in white except for a black t coat, steps out and stares at Bill and Ted, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: It's ... you.

dialogues.speaker: TED"
dialogues.text: Yah, it's us. (te Bill) Who are we?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: (to Woman) Excuse me, but what year is this?

dialogues.speaker: TED .
dialogues.text: Whoa! Bill! We went way too far forward!

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: The phone booth musta got broke in England.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: (looks around) So this is the future ...

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: (looks around, nods) Looks like a Yes album cover. Then Bill nudges Ted and the guys notice that --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 63 *: Woman has closed her eyes and is concentrating very hard. Soon other PEOPLE, also dressed in whites and blacks, start to come out of the domes, gathering around Bill and Ted and gazing at them reverently. Bill and Ted shift nervously. Behind them, Billy the Kid, John the Serf and Socrates lo on, impressed. Then, the crowd begins to do a slow, oddly ritualistic version of AIR GUITAR. They stop and look at Bill and Ted, who shrug and do AIR GUITAR themselves. The crowd is deeply moved by this. They begin beckoning t Bill and Ted. The guys are totally confused.
