dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PAN DOWN from the main sign REVEALS a bunch of KIDS, al between the ages of eight and ten, lined up outside the park. A MOTHER counts heads.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: ‘Three...five...eight...ten... eleven.... --- Eleven? She shrugs and turns to the Ticket Window.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Eleven children, please. |

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 84 And as the group moves through the turnstiles, we SEE tha

dialogues.speaker: NAPOLEON
dialogues.text: Tired, dirty, and disoriented, has wandered into the grou of children and is now being funnelled into the amusement park with them.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE PARK
dialogues.text: The children, in their bathing suits, are lined up to go down the slide. They scoot down, one by one, laughing and yelling. ‘Then -- Napoleon, in an ill-fitting bathing suit, steps up to the slide and looks down. He stands frozen with terror as the ATTENDANT steps up behind him.

dialogues.speaker: ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: C'mon, buddy. You're holding up the line. And he gives Napoleon a push, sending him flying down --

dialogues.speaker: THE SLIDE
dialogues.text: on his belly, head first, eyes wide open.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE BOTTOM OF THE SLIDE
dialogues.text: Napoleon lands with a splash and disappears under the water. We HOLD for a beat, until -- He resurfaces, an amazed and excited grin on his face. He shakes his head and looks around. He likes this.

dialogues.speaker: NAPOLEON
dialogues.text: {to himself) Bon. Tres, tres bon! And as he jumps out of the pool, running after the other kids, --

dialogues.speaker: NAPOLEON
dialogues.text: Attendez! Attendez! CUT To:

dialogues.speaker: A QUICK SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: in which Napoleon rides all the slides. He goes down on his back, on his butt, on his stomach. Re even “races" some of the other kits é¢rum.  0

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 85 We finish with a flurry of SHOTS of Napoleon landing in t pools at the bottoms of the slides -- splash, splash, splash -- and, as he pops out of the water for the third time -- : ,

dialogues.speaker: FOUR HANDS
dialogues.text: reach INTO FRAME and pull him out. PULL BACK TO REVEAL Bill and Ted, who dry off the relucta Napoleon and lead him toward Missy and the awaiting stati wagon.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: C'mon, Napoleon, everybody's waitin' for us at the mall.

dialogues.speaker: SMASH CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. MALL - “INTERNATIONAL KITCHENS" The Figures' table is empty. HOLD for a BEAT on the empty cups and crumpled napkins. Then we HEAR the opening notes of BEETHOVEN'S FIFTH SYMPHONY, and we:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which come down on the keyboard of an ultra-modern SYNTHESIZER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEALS that we are in a MUSIC STORE. A cheesy SALESMAN approaches Beethoven.

dialogues.speaker: SALESMAN
dialogues.text: You a musician? (beat) Here. Try this. The Salesman reaches over the keyboard and pushes a BUTTO labeled “ROCK AND ROLL." The tempo changes. Beethoven's eyes widen. And as HE CONTINUES TO PLAY, OVER THE FOLLOWING, WE: cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: O THE FRONT OF A MOVIE THEATER
dialogues.text: where ‘Billy the Kid and John the Serf are hitting on two 14- year-old girls. (John the Serf is now wearing an "I ‘heart' San Dimas" t-shirt.)

dialogues.speaker: BILLY THE KID
dialogues.text: (to the girls) I'm Billy and this is John. I'm an outlaw.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN THE SERF
dialogues.text: (bragging) And I own land. The girls giggle, especially when -- SIGMUND FREUD, eating a Hot Doq on a Stick, joins them.

dialogues.speaker: FREUD
dialogues.text: (to the girls) Hi, I'm Sigmund Freud. The girls giggle some more.

dialogues.speaker: S
dialogues.text: (stroking his goatee) You both seem to be suffering from a mild form of hysteria.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: {to Freud) You geek. And the girls get up and leave. Billy the Kid glares at Freud.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY THE KID
dialogues.text: Way to go, egghead. Billy the Kid and John the Serf take off after the girls, leaving -- .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: | Alone in front of the movie theater. He takes a bite fr | . his Hot Dog,. spilling mustard on his beard. As he tu . walk away, we SEE that someone has taped a "KICK ME" si / onto the back of his pants. | . Meanwhile --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 87 ON THE MAiN FLOOR - AT A "CARICATURE BOOTH" JOAN OF ARC is watching a cheesy CARICATURIST do a ridiculous "portrait" of JULIUS CAESAR. (The drawing depicts a large-nosed Caesar on a surfboard, with the nam “Julius" broadly written across it.)

dialogues.speaker: CARICATURIST
dialogues.text: {to Caesar) You got what I call a “Roman nose." See? Joan of Arc's attention is diverted by a couple of BEEFY MEN, who walk past her and enter a health club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joan of Arc enters behind the two men, intrigued. She walks into --

dialogues.speaker: A WEIGHT ROOM
dialogues.text: and observes sweaty, scantily-clad men and women strapped into Nautilus machines, riding "LifeCycles," and liftin barbelis. , This scares her. : She turns, and exits onto --

dialogues.speaker: AN AEROBICS FLOOR
dialogues.text: Where a class is in mid-session. The INSTRUCTOR steps up behind the dumbfounded Joan.

dialogues.speaker: INSTRUCTOR
dialogues.text: Hey, loosen up. Life can’t be that serious. And as the Instructor begins to pummel Joan's shoulders, we: cuT To:

dialogues.speaker: A ROW OF PUBLIC PHONES
dialogues.text: Where SOCRATES is staring, transfixed, at a TEENAGED GIRL who is talking into one of the phones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wo

dialogues.speaker: TEENAGED GIRL
dialogues.text: (into phone; re: Socrates) Sandy, I'm serious. This mega-grimster is totally scorching me. Socrates, confused by this, picks up another phone and begins imitating the girl.

dialogues.speaker: SOCRATES
dialogues.text: {into phone) Sannierees. Isega grimsoto scorcheemee, A beat. The girl stares at Socrates and -- -- a FLASH goes off as: IN AN “OLD TIME PHOTO SHOP" ~- ABE LINCOLN Is photographed by a skittish, overweight HIGH SCHOOL KID

dialogues.speaker: PHOTOGRAPHER
dialogues.text: Okay. Um, I need the Lincoln Hat and the Stupid Beard back.

dialogues.speaker: LINCOLN
dialogues.text: I'm Abraham Lincoln.

dialogues.speaker: PHOTOGRAPHER
dialogues.text: Yeah, right. Ha ha ha. C'mon, mister. Lincoln YELPS as the boy tugs at his beard. A tussle ensues, and Lincoln breaks free, running out into --

dialogues.speaker: THE MALL
dialogues.text: Where he runs into GENGHIS KHAN. The Photographer runs ou after Lincoln, but retreats, terrified, when Genghis Khan raises his club and growls at him.

dialogues.speaker: LINCOLN
dialogues.text: (to Khan) Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: KHAN
dialogues.text: Brushes it off with a casual GRUNT, then turns and enters

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 89 Where he is drawn to a row of aluminum baseball bats. He picks one up, favorably comparing it to his wooden club. Then, he looks behind him, startled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEALS a MANNEQUIN of a baseball player, his bat poised, ready to swing.

dialogues.speaker: KHAN
dialogues.text: Cocks his bat and, with a savage yell, knocks the mannequin's head off. Behind him, two SECURITY GUARDS rus into the store, and, as --

dialogues.speaker: BEETHOVEN
dialogues.text: Rocks away on his Pifth Symphony, a crowd now gathering around him in the music store, we: cuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The station wagon screeches around a corner, en route bac to the mall. :

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted, taking notes, is questioning Napoleon, who sits between he and Bill. Napoleon looks very relaxed; his fac is sunburned, his hair is slicked back, and he wears a thick white layer of "Nose-Kote". Ted points to Napoleon's "I Made_a Pig of Myself at Farrells" button,

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Okay, so you did not like Farrelis, right? Napoleon shakes his head. Ted pantomimes bowling.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: And you didn't like bowling, either? Napoleon shakes his head even more vigorously.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: But you did like Raging Waters?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cy

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 30 Napoleon nods, smiles wroadly. Ted notes this and turns t Bill. TED — What time is it, dude?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Two twenty-one.

dialogues.speaker: EXT, SAN DIMAS STREET
dialogues.text: Shoots past the POLICE STATION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Picks up the ringing telephone.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: this is Captain Williams. (beat) What??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now playing the synthesizer like a man possessed. He cranks the volume up even louder and we: cuT To:

dialogues.speaker: THE AEROBICS ROOM
dialogues.text: where Joan of Arc, doing the fiercest aerobics routine imaginable, has replaced the aerobics instructor and is n ieading the class.

dialogues.speaker: IN AN EAR PIERCING KIOSK
dialogues.text: crouch behind the counter, hiding from two teenaged SECURITY GUARDS. Freud looks over at Lincoln.

dialogues.speaker: FREUD
dialogues.text: You're a very great man.

dialogues.speaker: . LINCOLN
dialogues.text: Thank you. Beat. Freud looks at Lincoln, expectantly.

dialogues.speaker: LINCOLN
dialogues.text: I don't know who you are, but I expect that you are too.

dialogues.speaker: FREUD
dialogues.text: Thank you. Freud turns and Lincoln sees the "KICK ME" sign on his rear. Lincoln shrugs, then kicks him. Freud is about to protest when -- Lincoln spots a SECURITY GUARD approaching and the two me dash --

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE MALL
dialogues.text: where they attempt to escape the Security Guards by runni up the down escalator, thus causing a massive pile-up. Meanwhile, directly BEHIND THEM --

dialogues.speaker: IN BIG
dialogues.text: wards off more Security Guards with bowling balls, boxing gloves, and tennis rackets. Finally, he jumps onto a trampoline and bounds out onto --

dialogues.speaker: THE MALL FLOOR
dialogues.text: just as Billy the Kid and John the Serf rush by.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY THE KID
dialogues.text: (gun in air) Yeee-hawwwww! !!

dialogues.speaker: JOHN THE SERF
dialogues.text: (squirt gun in air) Yeee-hawwwww!!!

dialogues.speaker: GENGHIS KHAN
dialogues.text: (bat in air) Yeee-hawwwww!!! The three Figures look at each other, do a ferocious AIR GUITAR, and run OUT OF FRAME just as, BEHIND THEM --

dialogues.speaker: THE GLASS ELEVATOR
dialogues.text: opens, revealing Socrates, who studies the chaotic situation briefly, pushes the “up" button and RISES OUT O FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE MUSIC STORE
dialogues.text: pounds fiercely on the keyboard, every button and knob no cranked to the max. A Security Guard tries to pull him away from the synthesizer, and as the MUSIC THUNDERS towa its climax --

dialogues.speaker: LINCOLN AND FREUD
dialogues.text: are grabbed on the escalator, and --

dialogues.speaker: JULIUS CAESAR
dialogues.text: is apprehended in McDONALDLAND, and --

dialogues.speaker: JOAN OF ARC
dialogues.text: is-‘cornered in a racketball court, and --

dialogues.speaker: BILLY THE KID, JOHN THE SERF, AND GENGHIS KHAN
dialogues.text: rush onto an Ice Skating Rink, sliding lamely toward more SECURITY GUARDS and --

dialogues.speaker: SOCRATES
dialogues.text: rises INTO FRAME in the elevator, stepping off right into the grip of ANOTHER GUARD. . Then, as --

dialogues.speaker: BEETHOVEN
dialogues.text: Hits the final, resounding notes of his symphony and is yanked away -- -- we HEAR LOTS OF SIRENS APPROACHING and we: cut To:

dialogues.speaker: EXT, MALL
dialogues.text: The handcuffed Historical Figures are being led out of th mall and into awaiting police cars. Nearby --

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: surveys the scene, walkie-talkie in hand, as the last Figure, Abraham Lincoln, is loaded in.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: Let's get these crazies out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: w a

dialogues.speaker: THE LINE OF POLICE CARS
dialogues.text: with the dumbfounded Historical Figures peering out the windows takes off. A moment later --

dialogues.speaker: THE STATION WAGON
dialogues.text: screeches into the lot and pulls to a stop. Bill and Ted jump out, spotting the departing caravan of police cars.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Oh no...

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: What are we gonna do now, dude? We only got a few minutes left! cur To:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ox, as "Socrates" is addressing the audience. He reads from a cheat sheet under his toga.

dialogues.speaker: OX
dialogues.text: ..,everything is different, but the same. Things are moderner than before...

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: watches. Behind him, the clock reads 2:32. Meanwhile --

dialogues.speaker: IN THE POLICE STATION
dialogues.text: A. "FLASH" goes off as Socrates'"mug shot" is taken. Then he is shoved into a nearby cell with John the Serf as Beethoven is brought in to be photographed. Across the way is Joan of Arc, in a holding cell, with a bunch of prostitutes and bag. ladies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEALS that we are in the back room of the hectic, buzzi Police Station. Historical Figures are being booked, photographed, printed, and locked up. CAMERA BEGINS PULLING BACK through the confusion and soon we are ina --

dialogues.speaker: UY QUESTIONING ROOM
dialogues.text: where we catch a snippet of conversation between a POLICEMAN (OFFICER JAMES) and Abraham Lincoln.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER JAMES
dialogues.text: Name?

dialogues.speaker: LINCOLN
dialogues.text: Abraham Lincoln.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER JAMES
dialogues.text: Birthday, Mr. Lincoln?

dialogues.speaker: LINCOLN
dialogues.text: February 12, 1809. CONTINUE PULLING BACK, to --

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER DESK
dialogues.text: where Sigmund Freud is being questioned by a PSYCHIATRIST

dialogues.speaker: PSYCHIATRIST
dialogues.text: Why do you claim to be Sigmund Freud?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you claim I'm not Sigmund Freud?

dialogues.speaker: PSYCHIATRIST
dialogues.text: Why do you keep asking me questions? Freud smiles and strokes his goatee.

dialogues.speaker: FREUD
dialogues.text: Tell me about your mother. CONTINUE PULLING BACK, to --

dialogues.speaker: A LINE-UP ROOM
dialogues.text: where Genghis Khan is lined up next to three other savage looking PUNKS. An Employee from the Big 5 points to Khan as we -- ( . CONTINUE PULLING BACK, to the --

dialogues.speaker: FRONT ROOM
dialogues.text: where Captain Williams is with the last Historical Figure Billy the Kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: wo wa

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: Empty your pockets. Billy the Kid pulls chewing tobacco, bullets, and 19th century money out of his pockets.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: Got any ID? Biliy pulls out a "WANTED" poster and proudly unrolls it.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: (unimpressed) Anything else? Billy the Kid shrugs and pulls out a Pudding Cup as we -- CONTINUE PULLING BACK, through the main door, and out int the station's --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: where, after a moment, the station wagon whips in and é . screeches to a halt. Bill and Ted jump out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: — You go inside and talk to your dad. I'm gonna scope the place out. Missy, I mean, Mom, please watch Napoleon. Napoleon smiles coyly at Missy as Ted rushes inside --

dialogues.speaker: THE STATION
dialogues.text: where he dashes over to his father.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Dad -- ! Captain Williams looks at Ted, fed up.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: Pack your bags, Ted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? an CAPTAIN WILLIAMS You're going to military school, Ted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Na,

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: But, Dad -- !

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: I_don't want to hear it, Ted.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: But -- !

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: Ted. Go home and pack your bags. Now. Captain Williams ushers Ted toward the door (above which clock reads 2:37), and forces him --

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE
dialogues.text: Where the door closes behind him. Bill rushes up. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: How'd it go?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Bad. Our Historical Figures are all locked up and my dad won't let ‘em out.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: If only we had your dad's keys.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: We could steal 'em, but he lost 'em two days ago.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: If only we could go back in time to when he had ‘em, and steal ‘em then.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Well, why can't we?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Cause we don't got time.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: We could do it after the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: report. Bill's eyes light up.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Ted! Good thinkin', dude! After we do the report, we'll time travel back to two days ago, steal your dad's keys and leave them here...

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: I dunno... (pointing) ...how about by that tree? The guys run to a nearby tree as Bill continues:

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: That way, when we get here now, they'll be waiting for us. He looks behind the tree, sure enough, A SET OF KEYS is tying in the grass. Bill proudly picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: See!?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Whoa! Yah! So after the report, we can't forget to do it -- otherwise this won't happen. (beat) But it.did happen! Hey! It was me who ‘Stole my dad's keys!

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Exactly, Ted. (looking at the watch) C'mon dude! We got some Historical Figures to rescue! And the two of them sprint toward the Police Station door stopping at the top ef the stairs to look back at --

dialogues.speaker: THE STATION WAGON
dialogues.text: Where Napoleon is still smiling at Missy, casually attempting to put his arm around her by faking a yawn.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Missy, I mean, Mom, will you please bring the car around back? : Missy nods and starts the car as the guys head into --

dialogues.speaker: THE STATION
dialogues.text: where they enter the front room, and crouch near the wall out of view of Captain Williams.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: How are we gonna get past my dad, dude?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: (thinks; then) Do you got a tape recorder at home?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Yah.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Okay. We gotta remember to get the tape recorder, and set a timer on it for... Bill looks up at a clock. It reads "2:39."

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: (concentrating) Got it. What should I say on it? We begin to HEAR TED'S VOICE emanating from an adjacent room.

dialogues.speaker: TED'S VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Dad! Hey dad! I'm over here!

dialogues.speaker: BILL AND TED
dialogues.text: Look at each other, grin, do a silent AIR GUITAR, and, as

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: leaves his desk and moves toward his son's voice --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 9s

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: Ted?

dialogues.speaker: BILL AND TED
dialogues.text: quietly crawl past, sneaking into --

dialogues.speaker: THE NEXT ROOM
dialogues.text: Where they stop in front of OFFICER JAMES, who looks up from his desk, recognizing Ted.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER JAMES
dialogues.text: Oh -- hello, Ted. I'm sorry, but I can't let you back here.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: That's okay, Officer James. Oh, hey, how come there's a Picture of Motley Crue in with your family portrait? . Officer James looks at the photo on his desk where, sure enough, between the family portrait and the glass frame i a photograph of the four snarling, devilish members of Motley Crue. .

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER JAMES
dialogues.text: Well, how did...? And as Officer James tries to pry the unwanted photo out the picture frame --

dialogues.speaker: BILL AND TED
dialogues.text: sneak past his desk.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: (sotto) You got that?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Of course I got that -- it was my idea. .

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Whoa -- watch it, dude. Bill points to an officer -- OFFICER CHED. But Ted brushe it off.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Oh, he's okay. He's my buddy.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER CHED
dialogues.text: {noticing them; friendly) Hi, Ted. :

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Hi, Officer Ched. The guys walk past him and Ched goes back to his work.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: (sotto; to Bill) Remind me to do something nice for him. As Bill and Ted pass, Officer Ched opens a desk drawer an much to his delight, pulls out a PUDDING CUP and a SPOON.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER CHED
dialogues.text: (pleasantly surprised) Hey...a pudding cup. He smiles as he cracks it open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile -- ww BILL AND TED Are now crawling toward the back room.

dialogues.speaker: . TED
dialogues.text: Dude! Check it out! Ted points to the side of a desk, where the "Wyld Stallyn insignia has been drawn. Under it is a note.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: (reading) “Dear Bill and Ted. Good luck on the report. Sincerely, Bill S. Smith, Esquire, and Ted "Theodore" Williams."

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: That was nice of us. Bill looks closely at the note, noticing an addendum.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Whoa -- look. (reading) "P.S. Duck.”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 191 The guys du, just in time to see --

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER LOGAN
dialogues.text: walking past, eyes narrowed suspiciously. He continues on out of the room. The guys breath a sigh of relief and check the "coast".

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: I think we're all clear.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Let's go, dude! The guys hurry across the floor toward --

dialogues.speaker: THE CELLS
dialogues.text: Where the Historical Figures -- mixed in with bums, derelicts and hookers -- all perk up when they see --

dialogues.speaker: BILL AND TED
dialogues.text: grandly crossing toward them with the keys. Ted moves to the back window while Bill begins to open the cell doors. Meanwhile --

dialogues.speaker: IN THE FRONT ROOM
dialogues.text: Captain Williams has finally spotted the jabbering tape recorder.

dialogues.speaker: TED'S VOICE
dialogues.text: -.-mow that you're finally listening to me, dad -- Captain Williams furiously turns the recorder off. All of a sudden it comes up again.

dialogues.speaker: TED'S VOICE
dialogues.text: -- there's something I want to tell you. Captain Williams spots a second tape recorder, placed a couple of feet away.

dialogues.speaker: TED'S VOICE
dialogues.text: (continuing) I'm not a failure, dad. I'm not ignorant. I'm not selfish, and I'm not --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © . As Captain Williams reaches for the recorder:

dialogues.speaker: TED'S VOICE
dialogues.text: (continues) Dad! Don't turn this off! I'm not done! But Williams turns the machine off. Ted's voice resumes yet again, from a third tape recorder

dialogues.speaker: TED'S VOICE
dialogues.text: I told you not to turn it off. Dad. Listen: I'm gonna pass the test. And we're gonna start our band. Williams, livid, turns and storms back into the station.

dialogues.speaker: HOLD ON TAPE RECORDER
dialogues.text: Which continues running:

dialogues.speaker: BILL'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Way to go, Ted. We stalled hin.

dialogues.speaker: TED'S VOICE
dialogues.text: What else do I say? A beat, then:

dialogues.speaker: TED'S VOICE
dialogues.text: (deep, airy) +.eand now, opening for Iron Maiden...

dialogues.speaker: BOTH VOICES
dialogues.text: Wyld Staliyns!! AIR GUITAR as the tape runs cut.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE CELLS
dialogues.text: The Historical Figures are now crowded by the open window BILL . (to Ted) : Is the ladder ready?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: (looking out the window) There is no ladder.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Don't tell me we forgot the ladder!

dialogues.speaker: TED _
dialogues.text: (pounding his head) Remember the ladder. Remember the ladder. Remem --

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Ted -- it doesn't matter. If it's not there now, we're not gonna do it, so you don't gotta remember.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: I don't gotta remember? Excellent! Ted does AIR GUITAR as Bill turns to the Historical Figures.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Great People, as time is of the essence, I must ask that you all work together so we can get down to the car. Billy the Kid, please show the others how to make a Human Ladder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Billy the Kid starts to climb out the window, we: cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: / striding through the station toward:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: where Bill is giving a “boost" to the Final Historical Figure -- Sigmund Freud -- when Ted turns around and freezes, seeing:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ~ (entering; livid) Ted. Just what in the heil do you --?? ed

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: {to himself) Bucket. Remember a bucket.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: Bucket?? What are -- ?? Just_then a BUCKET drops down onto Williams' head with a clang. (On the front of the bucket are the words: “Wyld Stallyns Rules".) Williams staggers around, trying to remove the bucket fro his head, hollow curses ringing from within.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Sorry, Dad, but we gotta get to our History report. About to leave, Ted turns back.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Oh -- I found your keys. And as Ted places Captain Williams' keys on top of the bucket and turns toward the window, we: cUuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: THE SCHOOL AUDITORIUM
dialogues.text: Where Randolf, as “Abe Lincoln," is just finishing his speech. The clock behind him reads "2:44."

dialogues.speaker: RANDOLF
dialogues.text: ..-and so, in conelusion, I find that San Dimas...is a nice place to visit, but I ‘wouldn't want to live here. Randolf smiles as the audience applauds.

dialogues.speaker: MR. RYAN
dialogues.text: scratches Bill and Ted's names off the sign-in sheet. He shakes his head and crosses to --

dialogues.speaker: THE FRONT OF THE AUDITORIUM
dialogues.text: where he gives a supportive nod to the gloating Randolf a steps up to the podium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: j

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Good report, Randolf. Good work, class. (to the audience) Since we're short one report, we'll be finishing a little early today. I hope this was as valuable and informative for all of you as it was for us. Behind Ryan, the clock nears 2:45. Then Ryan gathers his papers and steps down from the podi and --

dialogues.speaker: IN THE AUDITORIUM
dialogues.text: The audience and students stand and are beginning to mill about when -- -- there is the SOUND of a HUGE CRASH outside. Tires screeching, trash cans tumbling, voices yelling ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car skids to a halt in front of the school. Bill jump out and flings open the doors.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Thanks for the ride, Mom. As the excited Historical Figures begin to file out and mingle around, Bill darts toward the auditorium. Ted joins the Historical Figures and begins organizing them, like a first grade teacher, and we: curt TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Students, parents, and faculty members look around. Then JUST_AS THE CLOCK HITS 2:45 °--

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: -- bursts inside, out of breath. All heads turn toward him as he collects himself and face Mr. Ryan.

dialogues.speaker: O
dialogues.text: So

dialogues.speaker: IN THE AUDITORIUM
dialogues.text: There is nervous laughter and whispering.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Mr. Ryan, we are ready with our report.

dialogues.speaker: MR. RYAN
dialogues.text: Bill, I think you should go see the Principal.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: (emphatic) Mr. Ryan, we have our report. Snickers from -Randolf and Ox. People slowly start to sit, amused and curious.

dialogues.speaker: MR. RYAN
dialogues.text: (sighs) Okay, Bill...Where is it? Bill clears his throat and gestures grandly toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: My distinguished colleague, Ted "Theodore" Williams, Esquire, will now bring in our report. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE AUDITORIUM
dialogues.text: Ted moves down the line of Historical Figures, giving the each a final look. He smooths down Genghis Khan's hair, straightens Lincoln's coat, picks a bit of hot dog out of Freud's beard. Freud whispers something to Ted.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: (reassuring) Yes, Sigmund Freud, you look very nice.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE
dialogues.text: Bill, still gesturing to the door, is beginning to feel a bit uneasy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 107 People begin to giggle. Ryan shakes his head. Randolf and Ox smirk. BILL. (yelling) Ted! And finally -~-

dialogues.speaker: THE DOORS
dialogues.text: QPEN, and TED PROUDLY ENTERS.

dialogues.speaker: TED -
dialogues.text: (grandly) Ladies and gentlemen of History. Please come in, single file, in chronological order. Then, Ted motions to the door and:

dialogues.speaker: IN THE AUDITORIUM
dialogues.text: There is UTTER SILENCE as -- -- THE HISTORICAL FIGURES BEGIN TO FILE IN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every jaw in the class, including Mr. Ryan's, drops, as Abraham Lincoln, Sigmund Freud, Napoleon Bonaparte, and a the other Great Historical Figures, led by Billa and Ted, parade down the aisle. — ee _ oe Some of the students look down at their own makeshift costumes as:

dialogues.speaker: THE TRUE HISTORICAL PERSONAGES
dialogues.text: Grandly march past them, forming a line at the front of t auditorium.

dialogues.speaker: ON STAGE
dialogues.text: proudly step up to the podium and face the audience. Bill nods to Ted, who steps. forward. .

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Mr. Ryan, teachers, fellow distinguished classmates...it is indeed a pleasure to introduce to you, to tell us what they think of San Dimas, the San Dimas Mall, Raging Waters, and other elements of modern life...some of the ‘Greatest Human Beings Who Have Ever Lived.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And on the packed audience's absolute astonishment, we slowly:

dialogues.speaker: THE REPORT
dialogues.text: The following should flow together and overlap fluidly: -- A selection of Historical Figures addresses the class. Some use the chalkboard, others are soft spoken, yet others gesticulate wildly and thrash about. Those who can, speak English.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +- Joan of Are speaks quietly in French. Bill stands beside her, coaxing her along. -- Freud holds a Hot-Dog-on-a-Stick, pontificating grandly. Abe Lincoln reads from his Gettysburg Address envelope. Julius Caesar, surprisingly ——~nervous, Can't think of anything to say. Some of the other Figures laugh at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- In line, Genghis Khan tries to cut in front of Lincoln, but is rebuffed. As it goes on, the report becomes more and more of a "discussion." The Figures agree, disagree, urge each othe on, interject respectfully, etc. Most seem to be enjoying themselves. Some open Pudding Cups, Ding Dongs, etc. And by now, the room is jammed with literally hundreds of people, all of whom watch in total, awed silence, as:

dialogues.speaker: NAPOLEON
dialogues.text: of tanned and smiling, comes to the end of an animated ac \ ) of his adventures at Raging Waters. He finishes, and Ted leads him back into the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ne 109

dialogues.speaker: THE AUDIENCE
dialogues.text: continues to watch in total, stunned silence. Mr. Ryan's jaw hangs open. Randolf and Ox stare, awed and humbled.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: Rushes in, stopping in his tracks when he sees:

dialogues.speaker: BILL AND TED
dialogues.text: In total control of the rapt crowd. Ted steps out for the final introduction.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: And now, our last speaker -- one of the greatest presidents in American history ... Mr. Abraham Lincoln.

dialogues.speaker: LINCOLN
dialogues.text: steps out of line and moves toward

dialogues.speaker: THE PODIUM
dialogues.text: where, with a supportive nod from Bill and Ted, he turns toward the audience.

dialogues.speaker: LINCOLN
dialogues.text: On behalf of my colleagues, I would like to say thank you to Bill and Ted, for this wonderful adventure. Bill and Ted beam as the Historical Figures all nod assen

dialogues.speaker: LINCOLN
dialogues.text: And, I would like to close with what I feel is a fitting coda to all that you have just heard. Lincoln looks to Bill and Ted, who grin proudly.

dialogues.speaker: LINCOLN
dialogues.text: (beat) Be excellent to each other, and ... Party on, dudes. HOLD for a moment on the SILENT, AWESTRUCK AUDIENCE, and then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Prom is in full swing, the gym decked out with flower banners, and romantic lighting. Couples in formal dress dance to rock and roll MUSIC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's about seven p.m. and the sunset sky is a beautiful deep blue. After a beat, we HEAR MUSIC, the sky opens, and, along wi some miscellaneous debris from history --

dialogues.speaker: THE. PHONE BOOTH
dialogues.text: appears and drops right in front of the gym. The booth, charred and blackened, appears to be on its last legs. it makeshift Pudding Cup antenna looks about ready to fall off.

dialogues.speaker: BILL AND TED
dialogues.text: wearing tuxedos, their boxers coming out the backs, step out of the booth. They look tired and weary.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Did we put everything in the right place at the police station?

dialogues.speaker: . TED
dialogues.text: Yah, I think so. (beat) We forgot the ladder...

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: That's okay. Good work anyhow. Bill looks at Ted, who is now staring at one of the sever COUPLES passing by on their way into the gym.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: We traveled through time, we met lots of great leaders, we got a A+ in History, we broke the Guinness Book of World Recerd for most people ina phone booth ... and we still don't have prom dates.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Sorry, dude. We looked all ever England for them, but they weren't there. But Ted's still down. Bill attempts to cheer him up:

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Hey, at least we can get going with the band now.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Yah, I guess. Maybe we should start trying to get t-shirts. *

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Ted, before we get t-shirts, we should probably try and line up Eddie Van Halen. The guys are about to argue when they stop and look at ea other.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Bill. Maybe it's time we started learning how to play.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: (beat; nods) Maybe so, Ted. A Moment passes. Then --

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: c'mon, dude. Let's go inside. The guys move away from the phone booth and are headed inside when -- The phone booth DISAPPEARS. The guys stop and look at each other. TED . Dude -- where'd it go? Bill shakes his head. Then we HEAR MUSIC and the guys' eyes widen as, in a blur of LIGHT:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone booth RE-APPEARS, directly in front of them. After a beat, the doors to the booth open and Rufus emerges. -

dialogues.speaker: RUFUS
dialogues.text: Greetings, gentlemen. Bill and Ted are blown away.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Rufus!

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: I can't believe you're here, dude!

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Yah! And guess what? We passed!

dialogues.speaker: RUFUS
dialogues.text: (smiles) Excellent work, amigos. Bill and Ted beam proudly.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: So -- are you here to go to the prom with us, Rufus?

dialogues.speaker: RUFUS
dialogues.text: I'm afraid I can't, gentlemen. Rufus opens the door to the phone booth.

dialogues.speaker: RUFUS
dialogues.text: However ... I know a couple of pretty ladies who might -- Bill and Ted gape as --

dialogues.speaker: THE PRINCESSES
dialogues.text: step out of the booth, looking timelessly beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: RUFUS
dialogues.text: You remember Joanna and Elizabeth, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Hello, Ted.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Hello, Bill. The guys are elated.

dialogues.speaker: O TED
dialogues.text: Rufus! BILL. The babes!

dialogues.speaker: BILL/TED
dialogues.text: Excellent! AIR GUITAR as Rufus escorts each girl to her respective prom date. Then:

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Rufus, you gotta come in for awhile. It'll be most resplendent.

dialogues.speaker: RUFUS
dialogues.text: Can't gentlemen. It's time for me to go home.

dialogues.speaker: BILL/TED
dialogues.text: Home??

dialogues.speaker: RUFUS
dialogues.text: (nods) San Dimas. — (beat) Seven hundred years from now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill and Ted are astounded.

dialogues.speaker: RUFUS
dialogues.text: You guys were there. Remember?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: (starting to put it together) -..that desert place...with the domes...and the totally excellent music.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: (also catching on) . They totally worshipped us there, Rufus. a

dialogues.speaker: LO RUFUS
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, they totally worship you everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: BILL/TED
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: RUFUS
dialogues.text: You know that music you were talking about?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Yah! It's most triumphant. Rufus pulls a cassette tape out of his pocket and shows i to Bill and Ted.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: * So -- who is it?

dialogues.speaker: RUFUS
dialogues.text: It's Wyld Stallyns.

dialogues.speaker: CASE
dialogues.text: Showing the "WYLD STALLYNS" insignia -- Bill and Ted on rearing horses, holding phallic guitars, with Joanna and Elizabeth at their sides, holding lutes. The tape is entitled "Bill and Ted's Excellent Adventure.

dialogues.speaker: BILL AND TED
dialogues.text: look at each other, excited and amazed.

dialogues.speaker: RUFUS
dialogues.text: You guys are gonna be the greatest musical force in the history of this planet.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Us?!

dialogues.speaker: RUFUS
dialogues.text: (nods) In time, Wyld Stallyn music is going to bring humanity together and put an end to war, poverty, and famine -- forever. Bill and Ted stare at Rufus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oo

dialogues.speaker: RUFUS
dialogues.text: (continuing) That's why I was sent to make sure you passed the report. If you'd been separated, it might have been disastrous for life as we know it. Long beat. Then:

dialogues.speaker: BILL AND TED
dialogues.text: Excellent!! AIR GUITAR. Then:

dialogues.speaker: RUFUS
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, it's time for me to depart. The guys looks at Rufus.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Well...so long, Rufus. Thanks for everything.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Yah, thanks, Rufus. Beat. Bill and Ted move to hug Rufus, look at each other, then hug him anyway.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: We'll never forget you, Rufus.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Yah. Never.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rufus enters the phone booth, closes the door, and dials. Then he smiles, winks, and in a glorious burst of F light color and music ... Rufus is gone. We HOLD on the two happy, waving couples. Then Bill and Ted escort the Princesses toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While the girls head inside, Bill and Ted stop in the doorway, look at each other, and smile.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Bill, my friend? BILL’ Yes, Ted, my friend?

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: This has been a most excellent adventure. Bill and Ted raise their right arms aloft and, as they CLASP THEIR HANDS TOGETHER in undying friendship, we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FREEZE FRAME, and:

dialogues.speaker: RUFUS
dialogues.text: We HEAR tumultuous APPLAUSE, and, after a beat, a beautiful, glowing, gold medallion is placed around Rufus Wyld Stallyns MUSIC pounds as Rufus nods and smiles, and PAN past the phone booth, and up to --

dialogues.speaker: THE TWO PORTRAITS
dialogues.text: It's clear now that these are Bill and Ted, wearing their black "Wyld Stallyns" T-shirts. We also see the quotes under the portraits.

dialogues.speaker: "BE EXCELLENT TO EACH OTHER"
dialogues.text: and “PARTY ON, DUDES" And as we HOLD ON the two portraits with the quotes underneath, we: FREEZE FRAME. AIR GUITAR into SOUNDTRACK MUSIC. FADE OUT.
